translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  āsava sampayutta duka sa nidassana ttika
translated: The Dyad on the Corruptions and Associated🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The first triad.)

original: Naāsavasampayuttaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Naāsavavippayuttaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto sanidassanasappaṭigho🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe…
analyzed: na āsava sampayuttam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  na āsava vippayuttam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe
translated: With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The second triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction. (The third triad.)

original: vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽(Naāsavasampayuttanaanidassanasappaṭighamūle tīṇiyeva.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… aññamaññe ekaṁ …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi  na āsava sampayutta na anidassana sa paṭigha mūle tīṇi yeva hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe aññamaññe ekam pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The fourth triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The fifth triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction. (The sixth triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The seventh triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The eighth triad.)🔽With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction. (The ninth triad.)

original: Naāsavasampayuttaṁ naanidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: na āsava sampayuttam na anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: With the condition being a non-corrupted state that is not an object of perception and is not a reaction, there arises a non-corrupted state that is an object of perception and is a reaction. (The tenth triad.)🔽With

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka adhipatiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka
translated: … has a cause with that condition. (In brief.) As to cause one, as to predominance one … As to non-obstruction one …
